title: [Medicine] Study claimed that COVID-19’s public health impact is more than 50% greater than that of cancer or heart disease. In the 3 months postinfection, people who’d had COVID-19 had higher rates of death and many health conditions, including heart failure, diabetes, Alzheimer’s disease, and depression.

[Medicine] Postacute sequelae of COVID-19 at 2 years | While risks of many sequelae declined 2 years after infection, the substantial cumulative burden of health loss due to PASC calls for attention to the care needs of people with long-term health effects due to SARS-CoV-2 infection
